articles.title: From small farms to your cup: What it takes to make that one cup of fresh coffee
articles.description: OAKVILLE — As a stream of roasted coffee beans drops into a barrel, it fills an Oakville, Ont., roastery with a smell practically strong enough to caffeinate you. The roasted beans, now a rich, deep brown, were once small and green, bagged in large burlap sacks and shipped to Canadian ports from the
